A centralized and automated solution built on ServiceNow can streamline the entire process — from request intake to fulfillment and reporting.
By digitizing and automating this workflow:

  1. Students and coordinators can easily raise and track their support requests online.

  2. NGOs can prioritize and assign requests efficiently using built-in workflows.

  3. Donors or sponsors can get better transparency into how their contributions are utilized.

  4. Data-driven insights can help NGOs identify demand patterns, improve allocation, and expand outreach.

This solution ensures faster assistance, increased accountability, and greater educational reach for underprivileged students.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Many non-profit organizations working in the education sector receive numerous requests from students and communities seeking educational support — such as books, laptops, tuition aid, mentorship, or access to training programs. Currently, most of these requests are handled manually through emails, phone calls, or spreadsheets, making it difficult to track the status, prioritize urgent cases, or ensure transparency in fund utilization. This leads to delayed responses, unfulfilled needs, and limited visibility for both donors and NGO administrators.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

The Education Support Request App will be a self-service portal where students or NGO representatives can log different types of education-related requests such as:

  1. Book or stationery requests

  2. Scholarship or sponsorship applications

  3. Mentorship or tutoring support

  4. Laptop or digital device assistance

Each request will be categorized, routed, and tracked through an automated ServiceNow workflow.
Admins can review, approve, or assign cases to relevant departments or volunteers.
Dashboards will show real-time data on open requests, response time, fulfilled cases, and geographical trends.
Donors could also be given limited access to view anonymized impact reports to foster transparency.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  1. Access to ServiceNow App Engine Studio and Flow Designer features.

  2. Email or Notification integration for communication with requesters and approvers.

  3. (Optional) Integration with external donor databases or Google Sheets for NGOs who want to import/export data.

  4. Basic NGO data model (list of students, schools, donors) to be configured for pilot testing.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  1. Data privacy: Ensuring student information (like financial or academic details) is handled securely.

  2. Adoption & accessibility: Some students may have limited internet access or digital literacy.

  3. Customization needs: NGOs may have different workflows or approval structures that require configuration flexibility.

  4. Integration complexity: If the NGO uses third-party donor systems, connecting them to ServiceNow may need API configuration.

  5. Licensing constraints: For smaller NGOs, access to full ServiceNow capabilities may depend on partnership or developer instance limits.
